reviews.review_msg: Really easy class but Stefan doesn't seem really interested in teaching or going above the bare minimum of this job. Would be nice if he put in a little more effort and tried to communicate with the class more often. That would probably help the vibe since its an online class. But I get it Stefan, if I was as talented as you I wouldn't care either.

He sounds like a really nice dude and I really like how clear his rubric is. Otherwise, I spent a total of 5 hours on this entire course and did well. Ty  Smulovitz u a goat. My only complaint is he takes a lil long 2 grade stuff especially with final grades even though he alr marked everythin

Stefan is an overall great professor, definitely one of the most supportive and laid back profs I've had. He's easy to contact over email and responds fairly quick, his assignments can be time consuming and tedious but he does a pretty good job instructing. Yeah, overall his class was a good experience and I'd recommend taking the course.
I am updating my previous review! He did end up updating my grade. Fantastic professor overall, I have zero complaints.

Lowkey great prof?? actually so passionate, he ate fr ü´∂. Big assignments but he guides you well - says ‚Äúno cramming‚Äù but like‚Ä¶ u can lol, just block a few hrs. Weekly discussion posts‚Ä¶ pain üíÄ. Exams? 20 MCs. Lectures? If u don't have time for them, skip them.
Overall a pretty solid class and professor, however if you're at the verge of a letter grade (within 0.09 or lower) don't expect him to round up.

Good class. You learn a lot. Best part is Stefan seems to love his job and that makes the course better. Accessible via mail. Have to put significant effort for a good grade but the projects/assignments are fun. Course made me a better man and appreciate the little things about sound. 10/10

Was a very easy class in my opinion, but learned a lot about the topics covered in the course. Weekly discussion entries really make you think about the whole concept of sound. Assignments are straightforward with a clear grading criteria and are achievable with a high grade if you watched the lectures and video instructions
He's the goat. Never seen him but this course itself is great.

Class was super straight forward with clear criteria for assignments and grading. First 2 assignments gave very specific instructions to get you familiar with the software then after that it's basic instructions but easy to understand and follow. Assignments can take a few hours to finish but you can cram it all in one go if you lock in.

Decent guy who responds to emails quickly and seems passionate about teaching sound. However, lectures are way too dry and long. Doesn't check for AI used in weekly discussions so many people will abuse that, and the marking criteria for the last two assignments are insane ("top 1%" get an A/A+)

Weekly recorded lectures are engaging and don't feel tedious to watch. Assignments have clearly defined expectations and were fun to complete. Weekly discussion posts are based on completion. Midterm and final are both all MC. The creative piece was a blast to work on, you have total freedom in what you create. Do start it as soon as you can though

This class is a GPA booster. The lectures, albeit long, are mostly made up of interesting content exploring the different aspects of music. Four assignments and two exams make up the bulk of the grades but this class was a class to look forward to. The grading criteria were sometimes a little off, but he walks you through assignments.

Seriously an awesome course you need to take during your time at SFU. Paired this course with two harder pre-req courses and it was still a blast working with DAWs and composing soundtracks. Definitely an interesting course. Stefan was very accessible via email and gave clear reponses and rubrics. Highly recommend.

He does not know anything about music and his explanations for assignments are not accurate at all. His midterm questions are meant to trick you and decieve you, and sometimes all of the answers are correct or there is no correct answer with no options for either or. Terrible and unfair. DON'T LISTEN TO PEOPLE THAT THIS IS A GPA BOOSTER
Not just a GPA booster, but actually a class where you learn a lot of interesting content, especially if you are passionate about music!

Stefan was an amazing professor for CA 149, I took this course as an elective to boost my GPA and I have no regrets. There were 4 assignments with videos on how to do them and a written activity you had to do each week which took about 25-30 minutes. Overall this course was enjoyable and the grading criteria was very clear. Highly recommend!

This class was great, there was 4 projects in total that are very straightforward. He makes videos explaining how exactly to do them, which makes it easy to get a good grade. Amazing lectures, he keeps it super interesting!! 10/10 prof

Took this class online and it was pretty straightforward. The grading and instructions for the 4 assignments are clear (just make sure you read all the instructions). The 2 quizzes are tough but passable. Weekly lectures can be long though.
W course W prof

I love this prof, his lectures are so entertaining, especially when he pulls out all kinds of instrument. Every time I feel sad, I watch his lectures and feel better (it's productive too). W prof, absolute chad. I think the other comments already mention what this course is about, so I won't get in detail. I am here to just tell you how cool he is.
Super interesting content and lectures are very well done! If you see this course being offered with professor Smulovitz, I would highly recommend taking it.

I personally found his lectures interesting as he includes examples for lots of terms. He also brings out his viola every lecture lol. Weekly 50 word min. journals (completion marks) are an easy 15%!! The big assignments are worth 15% each but he makes step-by-step videos on how to do it. He clearly loves what he is teaching and is super chill!

No doubt taking him if you see his name! Chill prof and cool guy! Its only graded by 50 word journal writings, few assignments which just exactly follow his instruction videos, and midterm and final (all short simple mc). No music knowledge required. Very willing answering every questions, but he talks too much in lectures lol. GPA BOOSTER!

I took the course when it was in-person, extremely caring professor, showing up to class was worth 20% of the grade, all assignments have a step by step guide so you only have to follow it and you'll get a good grade. Final was take home and most of it was covered in the review class if I am not mistaken. Would definitely take again and recommend.
